ANT3017 - Muggle Studies: The Anthropolo.name: ANT3017 - Muggle Studies: The Anthropology of Harry Potter

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The characters and settings of Harry Potter are used to explore and discuss contemporary social issues and anthropological concepts.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of pseudoscience, cult archaeology, and creationism from a scientific perspective. Adherence to scientific investigation uncovers prehistoric facts that are more interesting than myth.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Human biological variation in an evolutionary perspective.

ANT3026 - Mummies, Zombies, and Vampires.name: ANT3026 - Mummies, Zombies, and Vampires: Anthropology of the Undead

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological exploration into the phenomenon of the undead (namely, zombies, vampires and mummies) and our fascination with this subject.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Extensive honors work in the field of anthropology. Expectations, requirements, and standards are greater than for standard General Anthropology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores the part culture and society plays in manufacturing vulnerability and the increasingly central role anthropologists play in disaster analysis, mitigation, and research.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introductory survey of the four major subfields of anthropology: Cultural Anthropology, Biological Anthropology, Linguistics, and Archaeology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the history of archaeological thought, theories, methods, and events in the development of human society from early modern humans to the first civilizations.

ANT2410 - Cultural Anthropology: Global.name: ANT2410 - Cultural Anthropology: Global Perspectives, Local Contexts

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to human diversity as exemplified among various cultures and ethnic groups.

ANT3010 - Digging Up Disney: An Archaeol.name: ANT3010 - Digging Up Disney: An Archaeology of Walt Disney World, FL

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of the culture of Walt Disney World Theme Parks using method and theory from the sub-disciplines of anthropology: biological, archaeology, linguistics, and cultural.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Human biological variation in an evolutionary perspective.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: How the ancient past and archaeology appear in popular culture and are manipulated and used by modern societies.

ANT3107 - Blood and Valor in the Viking.name: ANT3107 - Blood and Valor in the Viking World

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines anthropological and archaeological themes of Norse daily life, belief systems, mortuary treatment, material culture, and culture contact among Viking Age societies

ANT3154 - A Survey of American Historica.name: ANT3154 - A Survey of American Historical Archaeology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines historical archaeology of the United States from the arrival of Europeans through the early 20th century to understand America's history using archaeological principles.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Theoretical perspectives on ancient hierarchies of power.

ANT3082 - New Frontiers: Anthropology of.name: ANT3082 - New Frontiers: Anthropology of Space

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examine the basic physiological, social and cultural challenges facing human space travel and settlement

ANT3148 - Life and Death in Ancient Egyp.name: ANT3148 - Life and Death in Ancient Egypt

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Use of archaeology and physical anthropology to examine the lives and death of both common citizens and royalty in Ancient Egypt (3200 BCE-AD 600).

ANT3152 - Archaeology of the Greater Sou.name: ANT3152 - Archaeology of the Greater Southwest

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The precolumbian history of the Native peoples of the U.S. Southwest, from the region's first colonists to indigenous populations of the Contact era.

ANT3157 - First Peoples of the Caribbean.name: ANT3157 - First Peoples of the Caribbean

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ANT 2000, ANT 2140, ANT 2410, or ANT 2511 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the archaeology of the indigenous people of the West Indies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A comparative study of social evolution in Africa, Europe, and Asia from the earliest humans to the beginnings of recorded history.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The ancient Inca civilization, including examination of pre-Inca cultures and modern Andeans. Uses archaeological, ethnohistorical, historical, and contemporary anthropological sources.

ANT3169 - Life and Death in the Ancient.name: ANT3169 - Life and Death in the Ancient Andes

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Demonstrates the potential of human skeletal remains for reconstructing past lifeways in the ancient Andean civilizations of South America (Peru and Bolivia).

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cross-cultural concepts of sex, sexuality, and sexual intercourse throughout human history from an archaeological perspective.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Archaeological developments of North, Central, and South America from the hemisphere's initial peopling through the advent of European cultures.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Archaeological heritage of Africa, beginning with the emergence of modern humans and ending with the arrival of Europeans.

ANT3161 - Ancient Mexico: Aztec to Zapot.name: ANT3161 - Ancient Mexico: Aztec to Zapotec

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Achievements of civilizations in Mexico (Olmec, Zapotec, Aztec) as well as lesser known archaeological cultures.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Florida prehistory from Paleo-Indian to European contact including archaeological periods, cultural areas, sites, and artifacts.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A comparative study of religion, family, politics, philosophy, and other elements of socio-cultural organization of preliterate societies.

ANT3179 - Australian Archaeology and Ind.name: ANT3179 - Australian Archaeology and Indigenous Cultures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explore indigenous peoples, both past and present, through historical and maritime archaeology, as a means of unraveling the full breadth of Australia's rich indigenous cultures.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An examination of the Prehistoric Maya culture focusing on both the archaeology and current issues in the field.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The traditional and changing roles of women and men viewed in a cross-cultural perspective.

ANT3290 - Anthropology of Plants and Peo.name: ANT3290 - Anthropology of Plants and People

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological perspectives involving the interactions between people and plants.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provide students an archaeological perspective of fields of combat and military infrastructure from the Classic period to the early 20th century.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The profession of piracy in the context of Caribbean prehistory and archaeology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The culturally specific causes of refugee flows, responses to refugees, cultural issues refugees experience when they seek asylum, and resettlement experiences.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Civilizations of South America from the last ten thousand years, focusing primarily on civilizations of the Andes and other areas.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to the prehistory of Mexico. Guatemala and upper Central America from earliest times through the Spanish conquest.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The religious beliefs of native New World peoples.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Patterns in religious behavior in various societies, with primary emphasis on myth, rite, taboo, and festival social phenomena.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of religion in ancient societies, with a focus on hunting-gathering, early agricultural and early complex societies

ANT3451 - Race Matters: Anthropological.name: ANT3451 - Race Matters: Anthropological Approaches to Racism

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History of racism in the U.S. and around the globe, focusing on anthropological study of racism today particularly as it impacts African diaspora.

ANT3930 - First Peoples of the Caribbean.name: ANT3930 - First Peoples of the Caribbean

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ANT 2000, ANT 2140, ANT 2410, or ANT 2511 or Consent of Instructor.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The culture history of the West Indies as understood through archaeology including how migration and local adaptation influenced economic systems, social organization, and arts.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological research on corporate fast food in diverse cultural settings.

ANT3701 - Engagement & Social Change: Pu.name: ANT3701 - Engagement & Social Change: Public Anthropology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Application of anthropological methods to current human problems such as the environment, migration, globalization and health.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of archaeological field and laboratory techniques, including the interpretation of written archaeological reports.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the peoples of Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos and Thailand from the anthropological perspective.

ANT4108 - Empire of Remains: Bioarchaeol.name: ANT4108 - Empire of Remains: Bioarchaeology of Ancient Rome

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Use of bioarchaeology to examine the lives and deaths of everyday citizens in ancient Rome (3rd  c. BCE – 5th  c. CE)

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The exploration of the intellectual foundations of modern anthropology.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: One of the following; ANT 2511, BSC 2010C, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of species from the Order Primates, including their morphology, ecology, behavior, and geographic distribution.

ANT4105 - Saving the Plundered Past: Eth.name: ANT4105 - Saving the Plundered Past: Ethics and Controversy in Contemporary Archaeology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Social, economic and political contexts surrounding contemporary archaeological research and interpretation, with emphasis on ethics, heritage management, and law.

ANT3312 - Ethnology of North American In.name: ANT3312 - Ethnology of North American Indians

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A survey of the aboriginal cultures of North America, with emphasis on the pre-contact cultural condition.

ANT3311 - Indians of the Southeastern Un.name: ANT3311 - Indians of the Southeastern United States

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A study of the social and cultural history of the Indians of the Southeast.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course critically examines how culture shapes science and technology and vice versa.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Previous fieldwork is preferred, and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Field archaeology by participating in field schools at prehistoric Lucayan sites on Eleuthera and/or Inagua Islands.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Relationships between human cultures and societies and the environment from an anthropological perspective.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The historical ecology and archaeology of indigenous Amazonians, including evidence from archaeological, ethnographic and linguistic studies.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The study of language in a non-western setting; language and behavior; language and perception.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cultural practices/beliefs surrounding death; cultures/human concerns about body's decay after life, attempts to prevent decay and preserve bodies in life like state.

ANT3538 - Ancient Plagues: Archaeologica.name: ANT3538 - Ancient Plagues: Archaeological and Skeletal Evidence of Infectious Disease

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploration of infectious diseases through the textual, archaeological, and biological record.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An introduction to the study of human behavior in terms of mutual interaction between human biology and cultural environments.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Exploration of the ubiquitous, enduring and variegated human phenomenon of sport from an anthropological perspective.

ANT4406 - Pain and Suffering: The Anthro.name: ANT4406 - Pain and Suffering: The Anthropology of Violence

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Survey the phenomenon of violence in human societies by exploring anthropological perspectives and theories based in human evolutionary biology, archaeology, forensics, and ethnology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Archaeological patterns of human adaptation to coastal environments across time and around the world.

ANT4165 - Archaeology of Pre-Columbian S.name: ANT4165 - Archaeology of Pre-Columbian South America

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Seminar course on archaeology in South America over the last 10,000 years, focusing on civilizations of the Andes, Amazon, Southern Cone, and other areas.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The role of culture in shaping the experience and perceptions of health, sickness, and wellbeing in a variety of contexts.

ANT4189 - Lithic Analysis: Archaeology o.name: ANT4189 - Lithic Analysis: Archaeology of Stone Tools

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The manufacture and analysis of flaked stone tools and examination of the ways lithic can enlighten us about human behavior.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Central concepts and methods in comparative contextualization of health, healing systems, suffering, distribution of risk, and use of medical technologies from physiological and biocultural perspectives.

ANT4332 - People and Cultures of Latin A.name: ANT4332 - People and Cultures of Latin America

Prerequisites.text: One of the following; ANT 2000, SYG 2000, PSY 2012, ANT 2410, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: History and society of the peoples of Latin America, emphasizing patterns of subsistence and social organization.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Archaeological interpretations of death; basic data collection, skeletal analysis, and comparative study of mortuary ritual - both ancient and modern.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ANT 2000, ANT 2410, SYG 2000, PSY 2012, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Comparative study of peoples and cultures of the Anglophone, Francophone, Hispanophone, and Caribbean.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The cultural development of Native North Americans from prehistoric times to the period of the first European contact.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: One of the following; ANT 2511, ANT 2140, CHS 3501, any 4000 level Criminal Justice course, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Methods and instrumentation routinely used in archaeology and forensic archaeology.

ANT4171 - Anthropology: The Battle of th.name: ANT4171 - Anthropology: The Battle of the Sexes?: The Archaeology of Gender

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advances in archaeological research on gender, sexuality and social identity.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides students with knowledge and understanding of paleoethnobotany sufficient to understand, interpret, and evaluate plant data in archaeological, paleoecological, and contemporary research.

ANT4170 - Household Archaeology: The Arc.name: ANT4170 - Household Archaeology: The Archaeology of Everyday Life

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The archaeological student of households and the everyday lives of people associated with daily activities across time and throughout the world.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Psychological, biological, social, cultural, and environmental influences of food consumption and physiological status. Perspectives are cross-cultural, ecological and evolutionary.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Cities in the past and present along with the activities and social systems that create them from an archaeological and anthropological perspective.

ANT4195C - A Pot for All Seasons: Archae.name: ANT4195C - A Pot for All Seasons: Archaeological Ceramic Analysis

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The skills, knowledge, and ability to classify, analyze, and interpret ceramic artifacts commonly recovered from archaeological sites.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological survey of Africa examining the social, cultural, and economic diversity of the continent over time.

ANT4178 - Archaeology of African America.name: ANT4178 - Archaeology of African American Life

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (ANT 2000 or AFA 3102) and Sophomore Standing or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores the archaeology of the African Diaspora in the Americas.

ANT4483 - Health and Healing in the Anci.name: ANT4483 - Health and Healing in the Ancient World: An Anthropological Perspective

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A history of health and healing in the human past and how archaeologists can determine patterns and changes over time.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Critically examines the body from a cultural anthropological perspective

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Students admitted only with permission of instructor.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Experience methods of field archaeology by participating in field school at sites in Florida.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview to Geographic Information Systems (GlS) methods from an anthropological perspective.

Prerequisites.text: ANT 2000, ANT 2410, SYG 2000, PSY 2012, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Procedures and principles of ethnographic research methods.

ANT4591 - Quantitative Methods in Biolog.name: ANT4591 - Quantitative Methods in Biological Anthroplogy

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Biological anthropology methodological approaches to analyzing quantitative data, interpreting and writing results.

ANT4861 - Beyond the Anthropology Major:.name: ANT4861 - Beyond the Anthropology Major: Careers Applying Anthropology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applying skills and experiences from the Anthropology BA curriculum to the job market or graduate school.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Seminar course exploring literature in landscape archaeology while using annotated maps to understand landscapes at different scales and around the world.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: One of the following; ANT 4521, ZOO 3713C, ZOO 3733C, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The scientific study of the human skeleton and the methodology and techniques involved in the anthropological assessment of skeletal remains.

ANT4702 - Culture, Inequality and Global.name: ANT4702 - Culture, Inequality and Global Development

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological perspective on origins and contemporary ramifications of underdevelopment and disempowerment in the world system.

ANT4954 - Geospatial and Archaeological.name: ANT4954 - Geospatial and Archaeological Field School at Kerkenes

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (ANT 2000, ANT 2140, ANT 2410, or ANT 2511) and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides hands-on experience with using geospatial technologies and archaeological methodologies on an archaeological project in Turkey as part of a study abroad program.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: One of the following; ANT 2511, CHS 3501, any 4000 level Criminal Justice class, or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The study of human skeletal remains in relation to a legal context.

Prerequisites.text: (ANT 2000, ANT 2140, ANT 2410, or ANT 2511) and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Applying digital technologies and methods to explore humanity's past, present, and future. This exploration is grounded by developing anthropologically-based, transferable methods and skills.

ANT4560 - Birth to Death: Anthropologica.name: ANT4560 - Birth to Death: Anthropological Perspectives on Human Growth

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Evolutionary, ecological, historical and cultural perspectives on human growth, maturation, and aging.

ANT4481 - Anthropology of Drugs and Addi.name: ANT4481 - Anthropology of Drugs and Addiction

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological approaches of drugs and addiction in the U.S. and internationally as topics of cultural, political, economic, and health concerns.

Prerequisites.text: Junior Standing or any upper level course in Anthropology, Sociology, Psychology, or Social Work.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Anthropological approaches to mental health and examines mental health and healing in cross-cultural perspective.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Human biological variation and adaptation.

ANT4480 - Global Health in Anthropologic.name: ANT4480 - Global Health in Anthropological Perspective

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The exploration of current and emerging global health issues from an anthropological and cross-cultural perspective.

ANT4854 - Advanced GIS Methods in Anthro.name: ANT4854 - Advanced GIS Methods in Anthropology

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Advanced methods to Geographic Information Systems (GIS) from an anthropological perspective.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The fossil evidence for human evolution from Miocene hominoids through the australopithecines and the earliest members of the genus Homo.

ANT4956 - Geophysical Field School at Ke.name: ANT4956 - Geophysical Field School at Kerkenes

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (ANT 2000, ANT 2140, ANT 2410 or ANT 2511) and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides hands-on experience with using geophysical technologies on an archaeological project in Turkey as part of an annual study abroad program.
